snippet: The department announced Monday that William M. Welch II, who oversaw the trial team that won an ill-fated conviction against Senator Ted Stevens, left for a private sector job.
abstract: Justice Department announces the departure of William M Welch II, a high-profile prosecutor who ran its ethics unit during the botched case against Sen Ted Stevens and has since played a prominent role in the Obama administration’s efforts to prosecute officials for leaking information to the press.
lead_paragraph: The department announced Monday that William M. Welch II, who oversaw the trial team that won an ill-fated conviction against Senator Ted Stevens, left for a private sector job.

headline.seo: Ethics Unit Prosecutor Leaves Justice Department
headline.main: Prosecutor Who Ran Ethics Unit Leaves Justice Dept.
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor Who Ran Ethics Unit Leaves Justice Dept.
